intro: Dialium kingii, commonly known as the African sand apple, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The tree produces small, round fruits that are yellow when ripe and contain a single seed surrounded by a fleshy, edible pulp. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some local uses in traditional medicine.
